thread.title: Ex-Don to head haul of Saints’ debutants
thread.title_full: Ex-Don to head haul of Saints’ debutants

title: Ex-Don to head haul of Saints’ debutants
text:
Jake Carlisle to head group of recruits making St Kilda debuts in JLT Community Series against Port Adelaide  19pm @jakeniallfox Source: FOX SPORTS CONTROVERSIAL former Bomber Jake Carlisle will head a group of recruits from other clubs making their first appearances for St Kilda in its JLT Community Series match against Port Adelaide on Thursday night. 
The Saints confirmed on Monday that key defender Carlisle, who has been training strongly, will play against Port, while three other recruits from other clubs — ex-Collingwood tall defender Nathan Brown, former Giant midfielder Jack Steele and Koby Stevens (Bulldogs) are also expected to have their first outings for their new club. 
"I reckon they’ll all play this week," St Kilda football operations manager Jamie Cox said. 
The Saints will have nearly all their senior list available for the opening pre-season game, with champion veteran Nick Riewoldt set to play a portion of the match at Etihad Stadium. 
Live stream EVERY game of the JLT Community Series on FOX SPORTS. Get your free 2-week FOXTEL PLAY trial and start watching in minutes. SIGN UP NOW > 
Paddy McCartin, the club’s 2014 number one draft pick, is also expected to play, having endured a difficult 2016 when he suffered from multiple concussions and a late-season broken collarbone. "He’ll play," Cox said. 
But it is in defence where St Kilda will have the most significant change, with Carlisle and Brown filling key defensive posts. Carlisle, disciplined by the Saints for an incident in which he filmed himself snorting a substance in Las Vegas (just prior to being traded), missed the duration of the 2016 season because of the doping bans on 34 current and former Essendon players. 
The Saints plan to deploy Carlisle in front of Brown, playing in a centre half-back-like spot where his intercept marking will be effective, while Brown is slated to be on the last line at fullback. 
The only regular senior player unavailable for the first pre-season game is veteran Leigh Montagna, whom the Saints say has had a slight calf problem and will not be risked. 
Former Collingwood speedster Nathan Freeman, who has literally been hamstrung throughout his career at Collingwood and St Kilda, will not play this week, though Cox said Freeman was fit and training, but a hip problem had prevented him from playing in the last intra-club game and he needed a little more time. 
The incident involving Carlisle in Las Vegas from the post-season of 2015 greatly disappointed the Saints, but the club says the talented former Bomber has impressed with his attitude and training and won the trust of his team mates after his troubled arrival at St Kilda. 
The Saints have few injuries to date this year. Cox said 35 players from their list had completed 80 per cent of pre-season training thus far. View All Comments
